name: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl
Reason: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl is a trimesic acid derivative with three phenyl rings connected by two methylene bridges. The basic unit for this compound can be considered benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The presence of the methylene bridges increases the molecular rigidity and π-π interactions, which significantly raises the melting point. Each methylene bridge can add around +50 to +70°C to the melting point.
